subject: Re: [junit] How to test void methods??
msgSnippet: hi, thanx for ur reply. i did go thru the link u told, but still not very clear as to what is the best way to test the databse related methods. is it better to
messageBody:
hi,
thanx for ur reply. i did go thru the link u told, but still not very clear
as to what is the best way to test the databse related methods. is it better
to create a test database and carry out the tests or is there some better
way of doing this??


----- Original Message -----
From: "Mike Clark" <mike@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, January 02, 2003 6:53 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] How to test void methods??


> Pardeep Duggal wrote:
>
> >Hi,
> > Could someone tell me how to test methods that do not return any value.
For example, the loadFromDatabase() or similar methods that do not return
any value but in turn loads internally a vector or a Hash table with some
specific data. and the data it loads is accesible thru the get methods. by
calling the get methods and seeing if it does not return me null value is
one option, but this does not tell me whether the correct data has been
loaded.
> >
>
> Refer to this FAQ entry:
>
> http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#tests_4
>
> Mike
>
